Comment 1: 
Which provides everyone learning the language a wonderful opportunity to get an A in
their course by solving the problem. :)

// CodePointsByte returns the byte index of the nth UTF-8 code point in string s,
// or -1 if there are less than n code points or the input is invalid.
func CodePointsByte(s string, n int) int
{
	if n < 1 { return -1 };
	var cp int; 
	for b, _ := range s {
		cp++; if cp == n { return b };
	}
	return -1
}

There are an almost infinite number of string function variations. Any one string
package can't satify everyone. The language designers have fulfilled their basic
responsibility if it's possible to code a reasonable solution in the language.
